page.title: 02ST.JAMES'S PRIMARY WOLLASTON
page.content:
The most significant happening in our area over the last few months has been the opening of{Dudley's}newest school.{St.James's Primary}is a new church school formed by amalgamating the old{Wollaston C.E.Junior School,} which was 125 years old, and{Meadow {Park Infants School,}a mere 25 years old. The new school is based on the site of the old Meadow Park school using existing buildings plus a new and stylish junior and library block, an extension that is in keeping with its strong church connections. Many of the village community groups who previously used the old{Wollaston facilities have followed the school to its new site. The move has also shortened travelling time for most of the children attending the school.
By{Deborah Evans.
